meanings.definition: A person who spreads false and damaging statements about someone.
meanings.sent1: The slanderer told lies about his neighbor to hurt their reputation.
meanings.sent2: The community was shocked by the actions of the slanderer.
meanings.sent3: The gossiping slanderer always had a new story to share.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like arrows, the slanderer's lies piercing through the truth.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the slanderer's whispers, for they can tarnish even the purest hearts.

meanings.definition: To make false and damaging statements about someone.
meanings.sent1: He chose to slanderer his rival instead of competing fairly.
meanings.sent2: The group knew it was wrong to slanderer others behind their backs.
meanings.sent3: She would often slanderer her classmates out of jealousy.
meanings.sent4: The rumors began to slanderer his reputation, tarnishing his good name.
meanings.sent5: The act to slanderer can cause irreparable harm to relationships and trust.
